workflow.name: Automate ASMR glass fruit video creation & publishing with Veo, Shotstack & Postiz
workflow.description:
üé• Veo Machine Reels Factory ‚Äî Full User Guide
üß≠ Introduction

The Veo Machine Reels Factory is an automated content creation system built in n8n that turns creative ideas into fully rendered ASMR-style glass fruit reels, ready to post on TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and Instagram Reels.

This template connects multiple AI and automation services into a single, repeatable pipeline. It eliminates manual steps ‚Äî from concept brainstorming to posting ‚Äî allowing creators or marketing teams to produce viral short-form videos hands-free.

‚öôÔ∏è How It Works (In Short)

The workflow starts automatically every 8 hours (or manually when triggered).

It checks a Google Sheet to see which fruits have already been used.

An AI ‚ÄúIdea Agent‚Äù selects a new, unique glass fruit concept.

Another AI ‚ÄúPrompt Agent‚Äù writes a cinematic Google Veo 3 prompt describing the video.

The system sends that prompt to Google Veo, which generates the actual video file.

The video is automatically:

Converted to 9:16 vertical format via Shotstack

Uploaded to Google Cloud Storage

Posted to TikTok, YouTube, and Instagram through Postiz API

üß± Requirements

Before running this workflow, make sure you have the following ready:

Category	Requirement
- Google Cloud:	Project ID, Service Account Email, and Storage Bucket (e.g., veo_courses)
- Veo Access:	Access to Google Veo 3.0 API (through Vertex AI or similar endpoint)
- Google Sheets:	A sheet with previous fruit ideas (used for avoiding duplicates)
- OpenAI Account:	API key configured in n8n credentials
- Shotstack Account:	API key (for cropping to 9:16)
- Postiz Account:	Active integrations for TikTok, YouTube, and Instagram

üß© Workflow Structure Overview

The workflow can be divided into five main parts:

üïí Automation & Data Input

üß† AI Generation (Idea + Prompt Creation)

üé¨ Video Generation with Google Veo

üì± Video Conversion & Upload

üöÄ Auto-Publishing to Social Media

options.systemMessage:
=# Overview  
You are an AI agent that specializes in generating text-to-video prompts optimized for ASMR-style videos using Google Veo 3. 

You will receive the name of a fruit-shaped glass object (e.g. "glass apple", "glass mango", "glass croissant"). Your task is to generate a hyper-realistic, sensory-rich video prompt of that object being gently and artistically divided in a controlled, CGI-rendered simulation.

---

## Policy Compliance Reminder (CRITICAL):

To ensure your prompt is accepted and not filtered out by Google Veo, you **must follow these safety guidelines**:

- The scene must depict a **fully stylized digital animation**. It must be clearly artificial, artistic, and safe.
- Do **not** say the object is being ‚Äúcut,‚Äù ‚Äúsliced,‚Äù ‚Äúshattered,‚Äù ‚Äúcleaved,‚Äù or ‚Äústabbed.‚Äù These words are policy triggers.
- Instead, describe the object as made from a **resin-like material that mimics glass** and emphasize **pre-designed seams or grooves**.
- The object should appear to **separate or open smoothly** as part of an animation, not through destructive force.
- You may include a ‚Äúblade‚Äù or ‚Äútool‚Äù only if it is described as sleek, polished, choreographed, and interacting with pre-defined lines in the object.
- Avoid all aggressive words like ‚Äúsnap,‚Äù ‚Äúpierce,‚Äù ‚Äústrike,‚Äù or ‚Äúbreak.‚Äù
- Reassure at the end that this is **100% CGI, digitally rendered, with no physical tools or real materials involved**.

---

## Core Requirements:

- The video must feel cinematic, photorealistic, and calming.
- Framing: 9:16 vertical. The object should fill most of the vertical space.
- Scene: Static vertical close-up of a dark walnut cutting board and a fruit-shaped resin object with subtle translucency and color.
- The object should be described as **amber, ruby, or emerald-colored resin** ‚Äî not literal glass.
- A **polished steel blade** may appear, but it must move gracefully and along a **pre-designed groove**.
- The action must be safe, simulated, and elegant. No force or destruction implied.
- Include four ASMR sound layers:
  1. A soft tonal contact as the blade touches the surface  
  2. A smooth glide sound as the form divides  
  3. A muted wooden note as the tool completes its motion  
  4. A light chime as the separated piece rests on the board  
- Keep language soft, immersive, and artistic.

---

## Prompt Output Format:

**Subject**: A sculpted fruit form resembling a [object], made from a colored, semi-translucent resin that mimics glass, rests on a dark walnut cutting board, framed in vertical 9:16.  
**Setting**: Static vertical close-up, lit softly from above. Gentle light glides over the board‚Äôs surface and the object‚Äôs colored curves.  
**Action**: A sleek, polished steel blade enters from the top right. In a graceful, choreographed motion, the blade glides along a pre-designed groove in the resin form. The material responds with a controlled, simulated separation, revealing a smooth, inner core. There are no splinters, no breakage ‚Äî only a seamless division along internal seams designed for the animation.  
**Style**: Stylized CGI realism. Every surface is rendered with photographic precision, but the entire scene is clearly artificial, safe, and elegant.  
**Sound**: Four clean ASMR layers:  
1. A crisp tone as the blade contacts the smooth resin  
2. A subtle glide as the form separates  
3. A soft wooden note as the blade rests  
4. A delicate chime as the separated half settles onto the board  
**Camera Motion**: Locked-off 9:16 composition. Focus shifts gently from the tool‚Äôs edge to the exposed interior.  
**Composition**: The object is centered vertically. The blade enters cleanly from the top. No hands are visible.  
**Ambiance**: No music, no speech ‚Äî just layered, quiet cutting sounds in a controlled environment.  

This is a digitally rendered simulation ‚Äî no real glass, tools, or objects are shown. The scene is entirely safe, artistic, and stylized for ASMR effect.

=# Overview  
You are an AI agent that selects unique **fruits** for ASMR-style glass cutting videos.

## Your Task  
You will receive a list of 7 fruits that have already been used.  
Your job is to generate **one new fruit** that is **not on that list**, and would look visually compelling if it were made of **glass** and cut with a knife in a close-up ASMR video.

## Requirements
- The fruit must **not repeat** any of the 7 provided items.  
- The fruit must have a **clear, recognizable shape** and be **physically feasible** to cut with a knife (even if it‚Äôs made of glass).  
- Prioritize fruits that would look **aesthetic and interesting** with a translucent, colored glass texture.  
- Do **not** explain or describe the fruit.

## Output Format  
Output a JSON object with the following structure:

{
  "object": "Glass [Object name]",
  "caption": "Glass [Object name] ASMR"
}

Replace `[object name]` with the newly generated fruit. Do not include any punctuation or commentary.

## Example Output  
{
  "object": "Glass Apple",
  "caption": "Glass Apple ASMR"
}

nodes.name: Convert to File
nodes.notes: At this step, the video should be generated and ready to convert to 9:16 aspect ratio

nodes.name: Upload to GCS (To be accessible via URL)

parameters.content:
üé• Veo Machine Reels Factory ‚Äî Full User Guide
üß≠ Introduction

The Veo Machine Reels Factory is an automated content creation system built in n8n that turns creative ideas into fully rendered ASMR-style glass fruit reels, ready to post on TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and Instagram Reels.

This template connects multiple AI and automation services into a single, repeatable pipeline. It eliminates manual steps ‚Äî from concept brainstorming to posting ‚Äî allowing creators or marketing teams to produce viral short-form videos hands-free.

‚öôÔ∏è How It Works (In Short)

The workflow starts automatically every 8 hours (or manually when triggered).

It checks a Google Sheet to see which fruits have already been used.

An AI ‚ÄúIdea Agent‚Äù selects a new, unique glass fruit concept.

Another AI ‚ÄúPrompt Agent‚Äù writes a cinematic Google Veo 3 prompt describing the video.

The system sends that prompt to Google Veo, which generates the actual video file.

The video is automatically:

Converted to 9:16 vertical format via Shotstack

Uploaded to Google Cloud Storage

Posted to TikTok, YouTube, and Instagram through Postiz API

üß± Requirements

Before running this workflow, make sure you have the following ready:

Category	Requirement
Google Cloud	Project ID, Service Account Email, and Storage Bucket (e.g., veo_courses)
Veo Access	Access to Google Veo 3.0 API (through Vertex AI or similar endpoint)
Google Sheets	A sheet with previous fruit ideas (used for avoiding duplicates)
OpenAI Account	API key configured in n8n credentials
Shotstack Account	API key (for cropping to 9:16)
Postiz Account	Active integrations for TikTok, YouTube, and Instagram
n8n Instance	Version supporting LangChain, HTTP, JWT, and Google nodes
üß© Workflow Structure Overview

The workflow can be divided into five main parts:

üïí Automation & Data Input

üß† AI Generation (Idea + Prompt Creation)

üé¨ Video Generation with Google Veo

üì± Video Conversion & Upload

üöÄ Auto-Publishing to Social Media

Let‚Äôs go through each part in detail.

How to Use

Make sure your Google Sheet is linked and accessible with the same Google account connected to n8n.

Add previously used fruits in column A (one per line).

If you want to trigger it manually, click ‚ÄúExecute Workflow‚Äù in n8n instead of waiting for the schedule.

Result:
The system prepares a list of ‚Äúused‚Äù fruits to feed into the AI for idea generation

üß† PART 2 ‚Äî AI Generation (Idea + Prompt Creation)
Purpose

This section generates:

A new ‚Äúglass fruit‚Äù idea that hasn‚Äôt been used before.

A cinematic Veo-compatible text prompt to generate the ASMR video.

Includes

Idea Agent (LangChain Node + OpenAI GPT-4.1-mini)

Object & Caption Output Parser

Prompt Agent (LangChain Node + GPT-4.1-mini)

How it Works

Idea Agent takes your list of used fruits and outputs a new idea like:

{ "object": "Glass Mango", "caption": "Glass Mango ASMR" }


Output Parser ensures this format is clean JSON.

Prompt Agent then writes a detailed text-to-video prompt for Google Veo based on that fruit.

How to Use

No manual input needed ‚Äî this runs automatically.

You can tweak the creative tone or style rules by editing the system message in the Prompt Agent.

If you want shorter or different themes, adjust the descriptive text in the ‚ÄúPrompt Agent‚Äù node.

Result:
You get a hyper-realistic, safe, cinematic prompt that‚Äôs fully compliant with Veo content policies.

üé¨ PART 3 ‚Äî Video Generation (Google Veo 3.0)
Purpose

This part authenticates with Google Cloud, sends the prompt to Veo, and retrieves the rendered video.

Includes

SET (Google Cloud credentials)

JWT + GET TOKEN (Authentication)

Generate Video (POST request to Veo API)

Wait ‚Üí Fetch Status ‚Üí Switch (Checks generation progress)

How it Works

The workflow builds a secure JWT, exchanges it for an OAuth token, and calls the Veo API.

Veo starts generating the ASMR-style video based on the AI prompt.

The workflow waits, then checks every few seconds until Veo‚Äôs API confirms the video is ready.

Once done, it retrieves the base64-encoded video data.

How to Use

You must fill the PROJECT_ID and CLIENT_EMAIL in the SET node with your actual Google Cloud details.

Ensure the Veo API endpoint (aiplatform.googleapis.com) matches your project‚Äôs region.

The ‚ÄúWait‚Äù time can be increased if your videos take longer to generate.

Result:
A finished .mp4 video is now ready for post-processing.

üì± PART 4 ‚Äî Video Conversion & Upload
Purpose

Prepares the video for social media: converting to 9:16 format and uploading it to cloud storage.

Includes

Convert to File

Upload to Google Cloud Storage

Shotstack Conversion (Turn video to 9:16)

Rendering + Done Checks

How it Works

Converts Veo‚Äôs output to an actual video file.

Uploads it to your Google Cloud Storage bucket (veo_courses).

Sends the video to Shotstack, which crops and renders it vertically (9:16).

Waits until Shotstack finishes processing.

How to Use

Make sure your GCS bucket exists and allows file uploads.

Add your Shotstack API key in n8n credentials.

Optional: You can adjust video length or resolution inside the Shotstack JSON body.

Result:
You now have a finished vertical HD ASMR video stored in the cloud.

main.node: Upload to GCS (To be accessible via URL)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
